Today's @code tip: copy path and copy relative path Right click on a file in VS Code's explorer to copy the file's absolute or workspace relative path to the clipboard. You can also right click on a file's editor tab to access these commands #code2020 pic.twitter.com/dfqQPfZZu7

— (@code) April 30, 2020

item.title: code
item.description:
Today's @code tip: search history Hold option/alt and use the up+down arrow keys to navigate through search history. This works in both file search and in workspace search #code2020 pic.twitter.com/D06aOK1ek3

item.description:
VS @code tip - Need better overview of your search results and search panel is too small? Use Search editor instead. This will give you search in new tab next to your files. item.description:
The latest Remote-Containers (0.113.0) for VS @code Insiders comes with support for #Podman. This requires a `docker` symlink to the podman executable on the PATH. https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-vscode-remote.remote-containers …

item.title: code
item.description:
The latest Remote-Containers (0.113.0) for VS @code Insiders comes with support for #WSL2. This requires Windows Insiders ( https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wsl/wsl2-install …) and #Docker Desktop Edge (https://docs.docker.com/docker-for-windows/wsl-tech-preview/ …) currently!

item.title: code
item.description:
Today's @code tip: creating new files in folders You can use '/' when create a new file in VS Code's explorer to put the new file inside of a directory. VS Code will create the directory if it does not already exist #code2020 pic.twitter.com/PTf9V5rugA

— (@code) April 28, 2020

item.title: code
item.description:
Today's @code basics: color themes Color themes change the color of both your code and the VS Code user interface. VS Code ships with a few builtin dark and light themes, and many more themes are available in the marketplace https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/getstarted/themes … #code2020 pic.twitter.com/sCdSHLVT10

item.title: code
item.description:
Today's @code tip: Inline Diff View @github has both side-by-side and unified diff views. You can get that "Unified" view in @Code by selecting "Toggle Inline View" from the diff menu. This setting persists once you turn it on. Special thanks to @roman_fedyshyn. pic.twitter.com/DOBCNQM3ZO

— (@code) April 22, 2020

item.title: code
item.description:
Today's @code tip: markdown preview VS Code's built-in #markdown preview shows a rendered view of your markdown. Open a preview next to a markdown file with ctrl+K V (cmd+K V on MacOS) Edit and scroll synchronization ensure the preview follows the markdown source #code2020 pic.twitter.com/hoWBJyONIi

— (@code) April 22, 2020

item.title: code
item.description:
Today's @code tip: ts-check Just add //@ts-check to the top of any #JavaScript file to enable TypeScript's type checking in it This can help you catch common programming mistakes and also enables some useful quick fixes https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/nodejs/working-with-javascript#_type-checking-javascript … #code2020 pic.twitter.com/se9M2CZFl2

item.description:
Today's @code setting: editor.formatOnType Format on type automatically formats your code as you write. This lets you focus on your code's logic while letting the editor handle indention, whitespace, and styling as you go #code2020 pic.twitter.com/KGbTOCtBGe
